intro: Cornus suecica f. semivirescens, commonly known as the pale-flowered dogwood, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to northern Europe. It features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by red berries in the fall. The plant has narrow, dark green leaves that turn reddish in autumn, adding ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. This cultivar is valued for its unique coloration and ability to attract pollinators.
